reviews.text: The hotel is nicely situated and the staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Well situated but disappointing room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was however, very disappointed with our room, which was extremely plain and simple and small.
reviews.title: Frequent visitor

likes.liked: — Beds, bathroom and daily linen change

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the website I was expecting a room with more designer flair. I felt more like I was in a children's classroom or a dentists: plain colour walls, no decorations, nic-nacs, pictures etc.
reviews.title: So charming

reviews.text: It was a functional room and not much more.
reviews.title: Great for couples and young familes

reviews.text: So I would say that you are paying strongly for the location and to bear in mind the rooms are not pretty.
reviews.title: wonderful little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful reception. Nice clean room. Excellent location close to centre of town and only 5 mins walk from the marina. Good breakfast. A bit pricey considering the lack of facilities (including a lift) - not that we wanted any other facilities. I would think that parking could be a bit tricky at busy periods but we managed to get one of the few free parking spaces in the street outside.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only wish is that they would install free WiFi connectivity.
reviews.title: Great location, good value.

reviews.text: Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in an amazing town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel occupies two old (very old) fishermen’s houses that have been converted, so every room is different. There are also some architectural oddities – for example rooms that are odd shapes, or having to step into an small courtyard to get from our room to hotel reception. Our room was plain and small, but well-finished, modern, spotlessly clean and with everything we needed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is brilliant, right in the centre of the seemingly untouched medieval village that forms the centre of Honfleur (unfortunately this means the nearest free car park is about 5 minutes walk away). We were disturbed by loud noises one morning - seemed like cleaners, but we're not sure. Honfleur is simply magical.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got Honfleur recommended by many people so decided to have this place as one of our locations during our roadtrip trough France. And we were not disappointed! The town is a real gem, with an incredible harbour-site. There is a lot of restaurants all over the place, and charming old buildings.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for 3 nights (April/May 2008) with my other half. We were very happy with our choice to stay here and can hartily recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise it is excellent, litterally 20 seconds walk and you are on one of the main squares.This means that it is easy to get out and about, but also easy to dump your shopping back in your room and to then carry on instead of having to carry it all around the whole day. It is not difficult to find the hotel when arriving by car (of course TomTom helps). the downside is the lack of its own private car park, however places can be found close by. I guess the parking problem will be an issue for any hotels in the centre.
reviews.title: Perfect base for Honfleur
Beautiful boutique hotel
reviews.text: Service

We were very warmly welcomed at reception and were made to feel right at home immediately. We were also very pleased to discover that there were no language barriers as all the staff speak good English. It great to be greeted by a smiling cheerful person and it really helped to get our stay off to a great start. (thanks Fatima!)
reviews.title: Very nice small hotel
Great little hotel - modern, minimalist design, good location
reviews.text: Rooms

We stayed in the cottage with our small children for two nights over October half term. Its really a self catering cottage and very cosy and comfortable, conveniently laid out, the living room is small and kitchen tiny but well equipped - the bedroom are specially nice, the main double room in the middle floor with nice bathroom, and a large kids room upstairs. Special mention for TVs in every room, and the travel cot with thick mattress (comfy for older children though probably not safe for a newborn) - and the patio for eating lunch. The ladies at reception were always lovely. Honfleur is extremely pretty and the market very posh - well worth a weekend visit altogether.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very close to the pretty centre of Honfleur but on a reasonably quiet street. The room was clean and had a nice finish to it. We weren't able to access the wi-fi but we were trying on a mac. The people running the place seemed friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast so cant comment on that. If you are in a car you will probably have to pull up outside and unload with the hazard lights on then go down to the waterside and pay in the large outdoor carpark which was about 12 euros for 24hours, maybe cheaper?
reviews.title: Cosy hotel in good location

reviews.text: Our first stop in this trip. We slept like babies and loved the fact that the harbor was a few steps away as where the restaurants. We gad to make some last minute changes and the staff where very understanding.
reviews.title: Great bed, brilliant location, no fuss. A parking place would have been nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Des Loges for two days in the middle of a heatwave. Had seen negative reviews of the rooms but was pleasantly surprised that our room (No 14) was a good size with a large comfortable bed. This room overlooked the narrow old street on which the hotel is situated which was a bit of a problem for sleeping as the rooms don't have aircon so we had to keep the windows open in the heat. The narrow cobbled street resonated car noise. Maybe supplying fans in the room would allow the windows to be closed overnight. To be honest we didn't ask if they had one, we just made do. Don't let this put you off the staff are friendly and helpful. The location is excellent for the shops, St Catherine's church and the inner harbour. Honfleur is a beautiful old town just 20 mins from Le Havre. Free wifi was included and parking is free if you use a car park around 300m further along the road.
reviews.title: Great location near the shops and inner harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife found this hotel for us to stay at during a two day one night trip through Normandy. Although I little tough to drive through the streets because of the narrowness (typical in these small towns). The hotel is on a small side street but very close to the harbour. The side street is nice a quiet during the evening. You have to park up the road in either a paid lot or a free lot but not a big deal. Hotel is small but at €110 a great rate for what you get. The manager is extremely helpful and she gave us a great resteraunt suggestion which we loved. Room is smallish (we have a twin) and the shower on the typical european small size but very clean and functional. Nice breakfast for €10 in the morning. Clean, functional, good location, quiet at night and very helpful staff. Not the Ritz but allows you to trully experience the city and the area.
reviews.title: Simple but great location and very helpful staff
